name: dermabrasion
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a surgical operation, usually performed by a doctor, that involves rubbing away the top layer of skin in order to remove scars, signs of age, etc.: Dermabrasion can improve acne scars and scars resulting from accidents or disease. She had had two dermabrasions and two chemical peels. Compare
microdermabrasion
More examplesFewer examplesMicrodermabrasion should not be confused with dermabrasion, which is an invasive surgical procedure performed typically by dermatologists or plastic surgeons under local or general anaesthesia.Diane wants her daughter to get both tattoos removed - a procedure that can require repeated treatments involving surgery, dermabrasion or laser treatment.She also submitted to dermabrasion, a procedure in which the skin is removed with a rotating wire brush until raw.There's a big difference between buying some mascara and tinted sunscreen and forking out for dermabrasions, injected fillers and glycolic acid treatments.
